milestones.text: Start with a basic learning resource, like Codecademy's free tutorial. It will walk you through the basics, including writing simple loops and functions and how events work on a web page.
After that, read a few books on the language to get a better understanding. Don't worry if the concepts are difficult at first, as you will understand more as you read/learn more.

Move onto a more comprehensive tutorial or course to get a better understanding of JavaScript. There are a number of free online courses available and Code School even offers free introductory courses.

Practice coding by solving small problems online with online resources like Codecademy, Codewars and Code Eval. This will help you understand the language better and build your skills in a practical way.
Continue to practice and fine-tune, learning more about the language. There are a number of great resources for that, including Mozilla Developer Network, books on JS, and blogs about JS.
Join a JavaScript community, such as Stack Overflow, to get advice and help from experienced JavaScript developers and connect with other developers.
